hedline.hl1: It's a Satchmo Summer At a New Orleans Hotel

abstract.p: New Orleans events marking 100th anniversary of Louis Armstrong's birth noted (S)

block.p: Any birthday party for Louis Armstrong promises to be lively, and a hotel in the city of his birth, New Orleans, plans a series of parties this summer.

From July 4, the 100th anniversary of Armstrong's birth (he was actually born on Aug. 4, 1901, but apparently he and his manager liked the other date more), through Labor Day, the International House, a 119-room hotel at 221 Camp Street, two blocks from the French Quarter, will offer a two-night package with cocktails, a performance at the Storyville District jazz club and a sampling of Louisiana hors d'oeuvres and drinks.
Any birthday party for Louis Armstrong promises to be lively, and a hotel in the city of his birth, New Orleans, plans a series of parties this summer.

From July 4, the 100th anniversary of Armstrong's birth (he was actually born on Aug. 4, 1901, but apparently he and his manager liked the other date more), through Labor Day, the International House, a 119-room hotel at 221 Camp Street, two blocks from the French Quarter, will offer a two-night package with cocktails, a performance at the Storyville District jazz club and a sampling of Louisiana hors d'oeuvres and drinks.

The price for this Friday-Saturday night package is $318 for a double room. On the first Thursday of each month through August 2001, in honor of Armstrong's actual birthday, jazz musicians will play in the lobby; an extra night's stay costs $119. Call (800) 633-5770 or visit www.ihhotel.com.
